, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Pakistani Muslim\nSinghis must know that they should be grateful to Raja Dahi rfor giving sanctuary\nto Prophet Muhammad's fleeing family from the deadly Ummayads.&nbsp; &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b>Raja Dahir gave shelter\nin his palace to a well-known follower of Imam Hussian, Muhammad Bin Allafi\u2013 a\nman much sought by the Umayyad in their deadly hunt for eliminating the last of\nthe Ahl-e-Bait (Prophet Muhammad\u2019s immediate family).<o:p></o:p></b></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b><br /></b></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b><span style=\"color: red;\">Raja Dahir offered refuge\nto Mohammad the Prophet\u2019s &nbsp;grandson\nHussain.&nbsp;When Hussian was on his way to Sindh he was\nambushed at Karbala Iraq , tortured and killed .</span><o:p></o:p></b></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b><br /></b></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b>Raja Dahir was killed\nin the battlefield, his beautiful &nbsp;daughters were captured as war booty in the\nIslamic tradition. &nbsp;The Governor,\nMuhammad bin Qasim, then sent them as \u2018presents\u2019 to the Caliph of the time\nKhalifa Sulayman ibn Abd al-Malik, to become a part of his vast harem.<o:p></o:p></b></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b><br /></b></i></span></div>\n<span style=\"line-height: 24.545454025268555px;\"><i style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</b></i></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b>Mohammed Bin Qasim is\nNOT a worthy first citizen of Pakistan\u2014their school text books tell a lie.</b></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"line-height: 24.545454025268555px;\">Sindh was annexed by Khalifa of Al Hilaj to his kingdom and was administered by his representatives. The Muslims spread Islam rather with deceit and the power of sword than the conviction of its being a better belief.</span><br />\n<span style=\"line-height: 24.545454025268555px;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"line-height: 24.545454025268555px;\">Today the Pakistanis has a sea port Muhammad Bin Qasim. &nbsp; Muhammad bin Qasim\u2019s uncle was the of the governor of Iraq. &nbsp;The new caliph Sulaiman blinded Qasim \u2013as per the amazing personal virtue of all the great muslim invaders. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"line-height: 24.545454025268555px;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"line-height: 24.545454025268555px;\">Like Babur , the Pakistanis&nbsp;honor&nbsp;another Muslim invader who raped their ancestor women.</span><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jhulelal\u2019s birthday\nCheti Chand which falls on the second day of the Chaitra month , is celebrated\nby few Sindhis who remember him . &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Though Jhulelal died at the age of 13, he is represented\nas a bearded man sitting cross-legged on a lotus flower that rests on a pallo\nfish which is found in Indus river. He wears a golden crown with a peacock\nfeather and wears regal clothes, and holds a 108 bead rudraksha mala in one\nhand. . &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is said that when the parents\nof the new born infant opened his mouth they saw a vision of Sindhu flowing and\nan old man on Pallo fish.&nbsp; A Punjabi\nastrologer in Nassarpur called the child Uderolal; Udero in Sanskrit means one\nwho has sprung from river waters. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The day\nthe child was born there was torrential unseasonal rain, as if to announce the\nbirth of the new water Avatar.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jhulelal was born &nbsp;on the New Moon of Month Chaitra 1007 AD, at a\ntime when Muslims were persecuting the Hindus. &nbsp;The Divine child ( compared to Lord Krishna ) was\nborn &nbsp;to Devaki and Rattanchand of\nNasarpur. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The birth of the child was\nprophesies when all Sindhis fasted for 40 days and prayed to Lord Varun, &nbsp;&nbsp;for divine intervention as their lives were\nin danger from the Muslim tyrant king Mirkshah-- \u201c convert or die\u201d.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jhulelal died in 1020\nAD..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After 40 days of\nChaaliho, the followers of Jhulelal celebrate the occasion with festivity as\n\u2018Thanks Giving Day\u2019 even till today.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the child was born\nand his mother put him on the cradle, it started swinging on its own , as a\nsign of divine intervention. The child was then named \u2018Julelal\u2019 - one who\nswings to and fro.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Jhulelal prayer has\nbeen bestowed to Sufi Saint Hazrat Lal Shahbaz Qalander (1177-1274 AD ), the\nRed Sufi. &nbsp;He belonged to the\nSuhrawardiyya Sufi order. &nbsp;They neatly\ninserted a LAL in front of his name so that the song looks tailor made for him. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lal was converted to\nmean red \u2014 and even today the Mulsim pilgrims to his dargah wear red. J</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">hula was converted to whirling around like\nthe dervish.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: yellow; color: blue; font-size: x-large;\">No lamps are lit in any\nMuslim mosque or Shrine or Dargah--nor there are any bells.&nbsp;</span></b><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shahbaz Qalander died\nin Sindh (Pakistan) where his dargah is worshipped even &nbsp;today. Thousands of pilgrims visit his shrine\nin Sehwan every year, especially at the occasion of his Urs. &nbsp;&nbsp;Sehwan was known for its splendour and\nsanctity as a sacred place for Hindus of Sindh. &nbsp;The earlier name for Sehwan was Shivasthan,\nthe city of lord Shiva.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Below: Kafir-Qila, an ancient Hindu\ntemple converted to a fort by Alexander the Great , at Sehwan</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-kHB1q91UpJA/UqibtP04adI/AAAAAAAAoQo/7ztvaP2xHHg/s1600/KAFIR+QILA+-TEMPLE+CONVERTED+TO+A+FORT+BY+ALEXANDER.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-kHB1q91UpJA/UqibtP04adI/AAAAAAAAoQo/7ztvaP2xHHg/s1600/KAFIR+QILA+-TEMPLE+CONVERTED+TO+A+FORT+BY+ALEXANDER.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Muslims claim that Shahbaz\nShahbaz was the spiritual disciple of Mansur Hallaj, the tenth-century martyred\nmystic poet of Baghdad. &nbsp;He lived in the\nruins of an ancient Shiva &nbsp;temple on the\nwest bank of the Indus. He lived in a &nbsp;hollow tree trunk where he meditated . . &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Below: Dargah of Shahbaz Qalandar at Sehwan.</i></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-grvOLDvuRuo/UqiZR-5PryI/AAAAAAAAoQM/Qpj-ceWhlVo/s1600/Shahbaz-qalandar.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"318\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-grvOLDvuRuo/UqiZR-5PryI/AAAAAAAAoQM/Qpj-ceWhlVo/s400/Shahbaz-qalandar.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He encouraged his followers to dance like the\nwhirling dervish as a way of achieving spiritual ecstasy, a tradition still\nfollowed at his dargah in Sehwan Sharif with the accompanying of dhamaal, the\nbeating of drums.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-39zOIdBoSrw/UqiZpfo7S1I/AAAAAAAAoQU/I7ER_z0M4hY/s1600/_40838856_pakistan_sehwan_map203.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"239\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-39zOIdBoSrw/UqiZpfo7S1I/AAAAAAAAoQU/I7ER_z0M4hY/s320/_40838856_pakistan_sehwan_map203.gif\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shahbaaz Qalandar was\nborn as Syed Muhammad Usman in 1177 AD in Marwand, Iran. His father Syed\nIbrahim Kabiruudin was a Sufi dervish dancer.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Below: Sehr Sehwan Sharif-- once a glorious Hindu land.</i></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ba6q5IDrSEI/UqiaN24ISAI/AAAAAAAAoQc/LSgUsvH1PS4/s1600/Sehr-Sehwan-Sharif-300x201.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"268\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ba6q5IDrSEI/UqiaN24ISAI/AAAAAAAAoQc/LSgUsvH1PS4/s400/Sehr-Sehwan-Sharif-300x201.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Muslims in Sindh were\ninclined towards the Qarmatian Shia rulers of Egypt. They are the ones who\nstole the black Shiva Lingam stone on the SE corner of Kaaba \u2013 5 feet above the\nground. The Qarmatians were half-Hindu and they looked upon Ali, the son-in-law\nof Mohammed and fourth Khalifa, as the tenth avatar of Vishnu.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Qarmatians survive today as Ismaili Khojas\n--- who, till 1937, were governed by the Hindu civil law . The Pakistanis still\ndo NOT know that the father oftheir nation Mohammed Ali Jinnah and the Aga Khan\nwere part of this sect.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The two main and\nhighest ranked tribes of Sindh are: the Soomra - descendants of the Soomra\nDynasty, who ruled Sindh during (970 - 1351 A.D.) and the second is Samma -\ndescendants of the Samma Dynasty, who ruled Sindh during (1351 - 1521 A.D.).\nBoth these tribes belong to the same blood line as well.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During my 40 years at\nsea, I have seen Sindhis all over the world.&nbsp;\nLot of migrant Sindhis can be found in USA, Canada, Singapore and\nHongkong.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The majority of the\nSindhi Hindus are followers of Shaivite tradition.&nbsp; A common greeting among Sindhis is\n\"Jhulelal Bera-Hee-Paar\". &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-gHL6IiUcMHk/VDTM0cuXwyI/AAAAAAAAwuc/0mIkajZV8aw/s1600/Ranif_Kot09a.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"426\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-gHL6IiUcMHk/VDTM0cuXwyI/AAAAAAAAwuc/0mIkajZV8aw/s1600/Ranif_Kot09a.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hardly any importance\nis given to The Great Wall of Sindh on the Kirthar range , built by Raja Dahir\n, know today as Ranikot fort. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are\n3 forts within this wall Meeri Kot, Shergarh Kot and Mohan Kot. &nbsp;Islamic zealots have tried to claim this fort,\nbut as you can see the arches are Hindu style with lotus and Hindu&nbsp;motifs. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Below: Lotus motif is NOT Islamic - &nbsp; &nbsp;no matter how much they try !</b></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-QtPw96JjgFI/VDTNUHY07hI/AAAAAAAAwus/LZd2H2kVYDM/s1600/1003099_680100588673637_46685jj2111_n.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"426\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-QtPw96JjgFI/VDTNUHY07hI/AAAAAAAAwus/LZd2H2kVYDM/s1600/1003099_680100588673637_46685jj2111_n.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is a perennial water spring 'Parryen jo\nTarru' which was highly valued for its medicinal property. &nbsp;&nbsp;Pani\nkhot gradually became Rani khot &nbsp;--originally\nmeant &nbsp;\u201cthe fort for protecting a water stream\u201d\n.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-nkgKE643VRo/VDTNE5Va9pI/AAAAAAAAwuk/K8AR9QgB8jY/s1600/428hh74259.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"300\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-nkgKE643VRo/VDTNE5Va9pI/AAAAAAAAwuk/K8AR9QgB8jY/s1600/428hh74259.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According\nto the census of India 1951, nearly 776,000 Sindhi Hindus fled to &nbsp;India\u2014due to ethnic cleansing. As of the 2001\ncensus, there were 2,571,526 Sindhi speakers in India. Sindhi is the only\nconstitutionally recognised Indian language without a region.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unlike other\ncommunities who choose to converse in their mother tongue, Sindhis speak in\nEnglish or Hindi even among themselves. &nbsp;No\nbank holiday is declared on Cheti Chand Day. &nbsp;Rothschild agve away the entire sindh having a\n7000 year old rich civilization and comprising of 55000 sq. miles --free to\nPakistan. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Not even a sliver of\nhomeland was left for the Sindhi Hindus. &nbsp;Today all are crying for Palestine and\nKashmir.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">What a disgrace !</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\nTHIS SONG MAST QALANDAR WILL REMIND THEM OF THEIR GLORIOUS PAST !<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<i><span style=\"color: red;\"><b>Grace and peace!</b></span></i><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"http://img.youtube.com/vi/YQLbbDHdOMw/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"http://youtube.googleapis.com/v/YQLbbDHdOMw&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"http://youtube.googleapis.com/v/YQLbbDHdOMw&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both;
